title: Coffee Prices Climb, Pushed Up by Bad Weather and Supply-Chain Woes
sub_head: Arabica coffee futures rose 76% in 2021 and have continued to advance
body:
Higher prices are here for your morning cup of joe.
First the drought came to Brazil, then the frost, roiling the worldâ€™s top coffee-growing region during the pandemic. Arabica coffee prices at one point last year were nearly twice their levels at the end of 2020. Investors are betting those weather effects, along with supply-chain snarls, will keep prices elevated in 2022.
